citeinfo.origin: University of Alaska, Anchorage, Alaska Natural Heritage Program
citeinfo.title: Alaska Biological Conservation Database

descript.abstract: Data Type: Vegetation/Land Cover/Soils; The Alaska Biological Conservation Database (BCD) is part of a standardized network among all fifty states, five Canadian Provinces, and eleven countries that provide information on population numbers, distribution, geography, ecology, rarity ranking and protection status for rare and sensitive plant and animal species, plant communities, and critical habitats. This database is a relational database management system application that contains many linked databases of which three are separate databases with a spatial component. These databases are the element occurrence database, the site database and the managed area database. Of these three data sets only the Element occurrence database has been automated in ARC/INFO GIS format to date.

idinfo.accconst: Data can be obtained through written request form and formal data inquiry procedures that are in alignment with University of Alaska Draft
idinfo.useconst: Some locational data relating to threatened and Endangerred Species or sensitive data have associated use restrictions.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.
